result.execSummary:
The defendant Warren B. Crockrom Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment - or Circle of Change Program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.  May Not have contact with Courtney Richardson other than 3rd pary arrangement for child.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Warren B. Crockrom Jr.

records.addlTxt: Revoked - Sentenced to prison.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 2 years WSP; 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision w/conditions; deft placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.
